action.action-desc: Ms. Velázquez (for herself, Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York, Ms. Norton, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, Mr. Gallego, Mr. Carbajal, Mr. Soto, and Mr. Vargas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the educator expense deduction and allow early childhood educators to take the deduction, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expand Education Deduction for Teachers Act.

section.header: Educator expense deduction increased, includes early childhood educators

subsection.text: Section 62 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking the heading and inserting Certain expenses of early childhood, elementary, and secondary school teachers., and
by striking not in excess of $250 and inserting not in excess of $2,000,
by striking kindergarten through grade 12 teacher and inserting, early childhood educator, kindergarten through grade 12 teacher, and
by striking in a school and inserting in a school or early childhood education program, and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end of subsection (d)(1) the following new subparagraph:
For purposes of this paragraph, the term early childhood education program has the meaning given such term in section 103(8) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1003(8)).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to expenses incurred in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2022.
